Package sqltoregex.settings.regexgenerator

Class SpellingMistake

java.lang.Object
sqltoregex.settings.regexgenerator.RegExGenerator<String>
sqltoregex.settings.regexgenerator.SpellingMistake
All Implemented Interfaces:
IRegExGenerator<String>
public class SpellingMistake extends RegExGenerator<String>
The SpellingMistake class allows creating a RegEx expression that takes into account different spelling variants of a word. It is assumed that omitting a character is "okay". Example: test â†” (?:test|est|tst|tet|tes) or (test|est|tst|tet|tes)

  • Method Details

    • generateAsList

      public List<String> generateAsList(String str)
      Generates a list of strings which allowed spelling mistakes. We assume, that one wrong character in the string is "okay".
      Parameters:
      str - current word
      Returns:
      list of string with alternative spellings

    • useOrDefault

      public static String useOrDefault(SpellingMistake spellingMistake, String str)
      Generates a regex with allowed spelling mistakes, if the param spellingMistake isn't null. Otherwise, only the string is returned.
      Parameters:
      spellingMistake - SpellingMistake object
      str - string to handle
      Returns:
      generated regex or str

    • generateAsListOrDefault

      public static List<String> generateAsListOrDefault(SpellingMistake spellingMistake, String str)
      Generates a list of strings with allowed spelling mistakes, if the param spellingMistake isn't null. Otherwise, a list of string with only one entry is returned. The entry is the given string.
      Parameters:
      spellingMistake - SpellingMistake object
      str - string to handle
      Returns:
      generated list of strings (with one or more entries)
